sentences.english: Cryptology was born among people, later circulated into the palace, and became popular among scholars.
sentences.chinese: 隐语产生于民间，后渐入宫廷，逐步士人化。

sentences.english: Learn the lingo of food claims.
sentences.chinese: 要清楚食品声称中的隐语。

sentences.english: Cant is an impersonal special language phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 隐语是一种客观存在的特殊语言现象。

sentences.english: Entertainment places have been important places where contemporary argots are spread.
sentences.chinese: 娱乐场所已成为当代隐语传播的重要场合。

sentences.english: These images are symbolistic argots about realistic prospect of Chinese society.
sentences.chinese: 这些影像是关于中国社会现实图景的象征主义的隐语。

definition: pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
falsification in writing/misrepresentation in written history/deliberate digression
alternative name/to refer to sth by another name/antonomasia
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
